FuncDef:
The lns-group command creates an LNS group and displays its view.
The undo lns-group command deletes the LNS group.
By default, no LNS group is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an LNS group.
It is a string of 1 to 30 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Each LNS group uses the IP address of the bound interface as the source address to communicate with the LAC. The device can determine the LNS group that processes the tunnel connection request from an LAC.
On the device, you can configure multiple tunnel boards and specify a tunnel board for an LNS. Multiple tunnel boards can be bound to an LNS group. These tunnel boards bear the load in turn based on tunnels.
Precautions
Running the undo lns-group command fails if the LNS group has tunnels.
